pages.text: Libys was a genus of coelacanth fish that lived during the Late Jurassic from the Solnhofen Limestone. First scientifically described in 1842 by Georg zu MÃ¼nster.A medium-sized coelacanth, Libys measured around 60 cm (2 feet) long. Its body proportions were somewhat "squat" when compared to those of many other coelacanths.

Two species, Libys polypterus and L. superbus, are currently recognized (with L. polypterus being the type species), though there is some ongoing debate as to whether they should be lumped into just one species.
